<br>

Ideas may come from internal projects as well as from collaborations with research programs at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new architectures, Research Scientists and Software Engineers work on challenges in machine perception, data mining, machine learning, and natural language understanding. You stay connected to your research roots as an active contributor to the wider research community by partnering with universities and publishing papers.

There is always more information out there, and Research and Machine Intelligence teams have a never-ending quest to find it and make it accessible. We're constantly refining our signature search engine to provide better results, and developing offerings like Google Instant, Google Voice Search and Google Image Search to make it faster and more engaging. <span id="job_summary" class="summary"><b>Position:</b> Data Scientist, Data & Analytics
<br><b>Reports to:</b> Director, Advanced Analytics at MLB Advanced Media
<br><br>
Overview
<br><br>
Who is likely to renew their season tickets? Or churn? Which fans are likely to upgrade to a package? Or buy again? How do we best communicate with fans and encourage them to attend another game?
<br><br>
MLBAM is looking for a Data Scientist to join its Data & Analytics team in our New York City office. The Data & Analytics team aggregates data from hundreds of online and offline sources and leverages it to provide insight, better serve fans, and drive growth for the league and its 30 Clubs.
<br><br>
In this crucial role, you will be responsible for manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from a myriad of sources. You will help drive a deeper understanding of MLB's fans, develop and validate predictive models, partner with Data Engineering to deploy them at scale, and collaborate with the Growth team and Clubs to drive ticket sales, fan engagement and business impact. You will also have the opportunity to present and share insights with business leads at MLB and the 30 Clubs.
<br><br>
If you love Data, Baseball, and delivering work that makes an impact, you've come to the right place.
<br><br>
Core Responsibilities
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Translate business challenges into data pipelines & model framework</li>
<li>Train, validate, and tune predictive models around fans’ behavior</li>
<li>Analyze, interpret & communicate the results of experiments</li>
<li>Deliver business value by translating complex data into meaningful insights</li>
<li>Effectively present and explain complex concepts to a non-technical audience</li>
</ul>
Qualifications
<br><br>
Required Qualifications
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>A strong foundation in probability, statistics, and algorithm development</li>
<li>Experience programmatically structuring and cleaning data, and not just analyzing highly cleaned data sets</li>
<li>You're a self-starter that's highly accountable and will take ownership of delivering your work</li>
<li>Strong understanding of building models, ability to validate and measure efficacy of models via various metrics, and the knowledge to know what metrics make sense for which situation</li>
<li>Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources</li>
</ul>
Minimum Qualifications
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>2-4 years of relevant experience in Data Science</li>
<li>Programming skills that allow you to be self-sufficient in handling data (Python, SQL, Scala, Java)</li>
</ul>
Preferred Qualifications
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Experience with large datasets and distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop, Spark)</li>
<li>Experience with statistical tools or packages: Python (strongly preferred; specifically with scipy, numpy, scikit-learn etc), R, SAS, SPSS, or Matlab</li>
<li>Experience with Amazon Web Services (or similar cloud services platform)</li>
</ul>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">dv01 is a data management, reporting, and analytics platform that brings transparency and insight to lending markets- making them more efficient for institutional investors and safer for the world. In a nutshell, we’re doing our part to prevent a repeat of 2008.
<br><br>
As the technological hub between lenders and capital markets, dv01 provides all parties with unprecedented data transparency, insight, and analytics. To date, dv01 has offered institutional investors insight into $15+ billion of securitizations and more than $64 billion of consumer, small business, real estate, auto, and student loans from the largest online lenders, including LendingClub, Prosper, and SoFi.
<br><br>
<b>YOU WILL:</b><br>
---------
<br><br>
<b>Build the next generation of financial models:</b> You’ll build data driven models covering trillions of dollars of consumer and business debt. To do so, you’ll have a massive quantity and variety of data at your disposal, some of which is only available in aggregate through dv01.
<br><br>
<b>Be intellectually stimulated:</b> You will be exposed to new ideas across data science, finance, and economics. You will also be exposed to the latest research in relevant fields, and be guided by both coworkers and external academic advisors.
<br><br>
<b>Be an integral part of a top priority project:</b> You’ll work closely with industry experts within and outside of dv01 to understand the data in the context of the market. You will work closely with the product team to understand which models best solve the customer needs, and with the engineering teams to realize that vision.
<br><br>
<b>Be customer facing:</b> You’ll regularly publish private and public white papers and decks on dv01’s Intelligence effort. You will communicate directly with our customers, which include top hedge funds and banks, to integrate their knowledge into our models.
<br><br>
<b>YOU ARE:</b><br>
--------
<br><br>
<b>Data driven:</b> You believe in the importance of quality, timely, and comprehensive data in constructing models. You are able to quickly structure large and messy datasets to experiment with a variety of models, regularly perform data analysis on datasets larger than 1GB, and have trained models on 100’s of GBs of data.
<br><br>
<b>Practical problem solver:</b> You have a strong statistical background and understand the tradeoffs and pitfalls of various data science techniques. You have an extensive toolset to determine mathematical and practical soundness of your models and avoid overfitting.
<br><br>
<b>Experienced with model productization:</b> You are experienced with all stages of the data science lifecycle and understand the additional considerations and effort needed to make a model useful for customers, including customer systems integrations, deployment, automation, and maintenance.
<br><br>
<b>Enthusiastic about expanding your financial knowledge:</b> You’re excited to learn more about the intricacies of the financial system. You are adept at learning on the job and unafraid to dive in to technical finance books.
<br><br>
<b>QUALIFICATIONS:</b><br>
---------------
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>3+ years of experience or PhD/Masters in a field such as math, physics, or computer science</li>
<li>Highly experienced with ad-hoc data analysis tools such as R, Python, Stata, SAS, or SQL</li>
<li>Fundamental/broad understanding of data mining and predictive analytics techniques</li>
</ul>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">The Regeneron Genetics Center (RGC) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company, whose goals are to apply large scale human genetics to identify new drug targets and to guide the development of therapeutics programs and precision medicine. Building upon Regeneron's strengths in mouse genetics and genetics-driven drug discovery and development, the RGC specializes in ultra-high-throughput exome sequencing, large scale informatics and data analysis encompassing genomics and electronic health records, and translating genetic discoveries into new biology and drug discovery opportunities. The RGC leverages multiple approaches including large population based studies, Mendelian genetics and family based studies, founder population genetics, and large-scale disease focused projects and has developed a network of over 50 collaborations with research organizations around the world. Including some of the largest sequencing studies in the world, such as the DiscovEHR study in collaboration with Geisinger Health System, and an initiative to sequence 500,000 participants with the UK Biobank, the RGC has built one of the largest human genetics databases, including sequence data from over several hundred thousand participants and rapidly growing. Our interests encompass a breadth of different areas across all therapeutic areas and the RGC is highly integrated into all facets of research and development at Regeneron. Program goals include target discovery, indication discovery, and patient-disease stratification. Objectives include advancing basic science around the world through public sharing of discoveries, providing clinically-valuable insights to physicians and providers of collaborating health-care systems, improving patient outcomes, and identifying novel targets for drug development.<br>
<br>
Summary:<br>
Seeking individuals with strong quantitative skills to join a team of outstanding investigators to develop analytical approaches, pipelines, and conduct analyses involving genetic data in founder populations. The overall mission of the Regeneron Genetics Center is to drive and leverage genomic discoveries as therapeutic targets. As part of that mission, we have developed a portfolio of samples from a variety of founder and special populations with unique opportunities for variant discovery and interpretation in the context of rich data from outbred populations.<br>
<br>
Responsibilities will include analyzing genome-wide genetic data from worldwide populations to characterize genetic diversity, genotype/phenotype associations, and interpreting results in the context of large-scale genetic epidemiology projects. Strong quantitative background and experience with regression models of genetic data, including coursework in statistics, is preferred. Competency scripting and programming in Perl/Python in Linux or other high performance computing environment is essential. Working knowledge of foundational population genetic concepts is desired. Level commensurate with experience.<br>
<br>
The position will require coordination and collaboration with other scientists within the department, research and clinical scientists at Regeneron, and will provide exciting opportunities to collaborate with industry and academic investigators. The RGC hosts a vast amount of data encompassing thousands of phenotypes derived from electronic medical records, integrated with genomic data. Together, these represent a landmark collection of information that will move precision medicine and novel therapeutic discovery forward as a new data-driven paradigm in healthcare.<br>
<br>
Responsibilities:<br>
<ul><li>Work within a team of scientists, programmers, database administrators, and clinical scientists, as well as external collaborators to analyze genetic and phenotype data from multiple and diverse population based studies.</li><li>Conduct data analysis and develop sound approaches for population genetic analysis, including quality control, to identify genetic variants which may be unique to specific populations and may influence clinical and biomedical traits.</li><li>Collaborate with other team members to summarize and visualize the performance of novel statistical approaches, and develop population and statistical genetics pipelines.</li><li>Coordinate with external collaborators and bioinformatics teams in mining genetic data from diverse populations.</li><li>Execute analyses in a timely, rigorous and reproducible manner.</li><li>Communicate findings clearly to specialists and non-specialists, and document work for training and replication purposes.</li><li>Assist in manuscript preparation, and contribute to the scientific community</li></ul><br>
<br>
Requirements:<br>
<ul><li>Masters Degree with relevant experience in Biostatistics/Statistics, Genetics, Bioinformatics, Ecology and Evolution, or related data science field.</li><li>Minimum of two years of hands on experience with statistical data analysis.</li><li>Level commensurate with experience.</li></ul><br>
<br>
Experience with manipulation and analysis of genome-wide genetic data sets is preferred. Additional qualifications include:<br>
<ul><li>Proficiency in principles and practice of analysis and in major statistical computing packages and languages; fluency with R, Perl/Python in a Linux environment is essential.</li><li>Working knowledge of population genetic concepts including population structure, identity by descent, inbreeding, and linkage disequilibrium.</li><li>Experience with genetic epidemiology approaches for genome wide association scans and/or rare variants tests.</li><li>Familiarity with Next Generation Sequencing analysis, alignment, and variant calling is beneficial, but not required.</li><li>Ability to multitask and manage simultaneous projects to meet deadlines with a strong attention to detail.</li><li>Ability to interpret and communicate analytical results in a clear, concise manner, orally and in writing.</li><li>Enthusiasm for collaborative science, and a motivation to contribute to work that will directly impact people and disease treatment.</li></ul><br>
<br>
This is an opportunity to join our select team that is already leading the way in the Pharmaceutical/Biotech industry. Apply today and learn more about Regeneron&rsquo;s unwavering commitment to combining good science &amp; good business.<br>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">We’re looking for Data Scientists to join our Data Science team with a focus on supporting teams that are responsible for revenue delivery through advertising and subscriptions. <h3 class="jobSectionHeader">About the role
<br>
<br>
</b>In this role you will be responsible for conducting behavioral analyses, designing, running and analyzing experiments, creating dashboards and building predictive models in order to inform decision making in a series of comple x product and business problems. On a daily basis you will help guide the decisions across the business with quantitative insights into user behavior . Our stack includes a wide variety of technologies such as HDFS, Spark, Python, Redshift and Tableau.
Some projects you might be working on:
<br>
<ul><li>Support integration with 3rd party ad exchanges to optimise media selling
</li><li>Refine our understanding of the subscription funnel to improve conversion rates
</li><li>Develop and refine multi-touch attribution and churn prediction models to enhance marketing ROI
</li></ul><br>
<b>About You
<br>
</h3>You are an experienced Data Scientist with a curious analytical mindset, strong product intuition and fantastic storytelling skills. You feel comfortable writing SQL queries and Python code and you are willing to learn new technologies. You have a background in a quantitative field (strong academic record preferred) and a track record of applying statistical inference and engineering in real world data science problems. You enjoy working closely with teams and you want to have a real impact in the world of music and creative expression.

<h2 class="jobSectionHeader">What You'll Do
</h2>In this role you will apply your exceptional academic background to develop and apply data science methods to improve and optimize our client’s performance needs.
<br>
<br>
You share our curiosity for new methods and technologies, and our enthusiasm for data science challenges. As such, you will support our client service teams to identify business hypotheses and metrics, and you'll have the opportunity to define and drive the analytical scope and method for projects.
<br>

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">The Regeneron Genetics Center (RGC) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Company, whose goals are to apply large scale human genetics to identify new drug targets and to guide the development of therapeutics programs and precision medicine. Building upon Regeneron's strengths in mouse genetics and genetics-driven drug discovery and development, the RGC specializes in ultra-high-throughput exome sequencing, large scale informatics and data analysis encompassing genomics and electronic health records, and translating genetic discoveries into new biology and drug discovery opportunities. The RGC leverages multiple approaches including large population based studies, Mendelian genetics and family based studies, founder population genetics, and large-scale disease focused projects and has developed a network of over 50 collaborations with research organizations around the world. Including some of the largest sequencing studies in the world, such as the DiscovEHR study in collaboration with Geisinger Health System, and an initiative to sequence 500,000 participants with the UK Biobank, the RGC has built one of the largest human genetics databases, including sequence data from over several hundred thousand participants and rapidly growing. Our interests encompass a breadth of different areas across all therapeutic areas and the RGC is highly integrated into all facets of research and development at Regeneron. Program goals include target discovery, indication discovery, and patient-disease stratification. Objectives include advancing basic science around the world through public sharing of discoveries, providing clinically-valuable insights to physicians and providers of collaborating health-care systems, improving patient outcomes, and identifying novel targets for drug development.<br>
<br>
The Regeneron Genetics Center (RGC) is a large-scale, fully integrated genomics program with the objective of using DNA sequencing to gain insights into disease mechanisms, identify novel therapeutic targets, and ultimately improve drug discovery and development to help patients in need. The RGC High-Throughput Operations group explores the intersection of genetic data with clinical information from many sources, including electronic healthcare records. Our analysis pipeline detects billions of genetic associations which are then mined to help identify new therapeutic drug targets.<br>
<br>
These positions are in Analytical Genetics in Tarrytown, NY. There are 4 openings for Summer 2018. Each opening is described below.<br>
<br>
Position 1: The student will work collaboratively with scientists, post-docs, and analysts on large scale sequence data sets from populations across a broad spectrum of phenotypes. Depending on research interests, projects may focus on: 1) evaluating the statistical robustness of genetic associations and vetting the results to help discover novel drug targets, 2) integrating software into our cloud-based analytical pipeline to gain hands-on experience with &quot;big data&quot; manipulation, 3) developing creative visualization strategies to explore data sets containing billions of data points and placing these data in the context of human biology, 4) implementing, evaluating, and interpreting machine learning methods to automatically mine large scale data sets of genetic and clinical information.<br>
<br>
Position 2: This person will be working in Analytical Genetics - Founder Populations and Methods Development. The student will work collaboratively with scientists, post-docs, and analysts on large exome sequencing data sets from populations across the globe. Projects will involve the application and development of statistical methods to evaluate the genomic architecture and population structure in unusual ancestries. Depending on research interests, project foci include: 1) characterizing population structure using principal components analysis of genetic variation, 2) survey of population genetic measures across diverse populations such as, genetic diversity, patterns of linkage disequilibrium and/or the distribution of the genome that are identical by descent (homozygous), 3) development of regression methods for sparse categorical data, 4) genetic epidemiology in founder populations.<br>
<br>
Position 3: The student will gain hands-on experience in the discovery and/or the validation phase of our work in RGC. The training foci include, but are not limited to, defining a disease/phenotype of interest, performing genetic association tests, building evidence based on published literature and public and internal databases, and/or validating the biological effects of candidate genes and mutations in experimental models. The specific goals of the internship can be tailored to accommodate applicant's interests and prior skills and feasibility based on time and resources.<br>
<br>
Position 4: The RGC High-Throughput Operations group explores the intersection of genetic data with clinical information from many sources, including electronic healthcare records. Our analysis pipeline detects billions of genetic associations that are mined to help identify new therapeutic drug targets. The student will work collaboratively with scientists, post-docs, and analysts on huge exome sequence data sets from populations across a broad spectrum of phenotypes. Depending on research interests, projects may focus on: 1) evaluating the statistical robustness of genetic associations and vetting the results to help discover novel drug targets, 2) integrating software into our cloud-based analytical pipeline to gain hands-on experience with &quot;big data&quot; manipulation, 3) developing creative visualization strategies to explore data sets containing billions of data points and placing these data in the context of human biology, 4) implementing, evaluating, and interpreting machine learning methods to mine huge data sets of genetic and clinical information.<br>
<br>
Start building your skills at Regeneron.<br>
<ul><li>Must be an undergraduate, graduate, or PhD student</li><li>Must be pursuing a degree in Genetics, Statistics, Bioinformatics, or Computer Science</li><li>Experience with Command line Linux and programming in a Python/Perl, R with regression or Scala is preferred.</li><li>Must be comfortable with human genetics and bioinformatics. Strong collaboration and communication skills are preferred.</li></ul><br>
<br>
General Intern Program Information:<br>
<ul><li>Must be enrolled in, or accepted to, an academic program pursuing a Bachelor's, Master's, PhD or PharmD</li><li>Summer Program is full-time (~40 hrs/wk) for at least 10 weeks and is paid</li><li>Prefer demonstrated leadership in areas such as campus activities, clubs, sports or the community</li><li>Minimum GPA of 3.0</li><li>You will work with a specific manager on a project(s)</li><li>Enjoy weekly 1 hour Intern Program events: learn about other areas of the company from VPs and other employees, soft skills workshops, networking, volunteering, and more!</li><li>Present to your team on your summer project</li></ul><br>
<br>
Transportation and Housing:<br>
<ul><li>A free shuttle is offered from the North White Plains or Tarrytown train stations to the Tarrytown campus</li><li>Get to know other incoming Interns on our closed LinkedIn page when you accept an offer</li></ul><br>
<br>
This is an opportunity to join our select team that is already leading the way in the Pharmaceutical/Biotech industry. Apply today and learn more about Regeneron&rsquo;s unwavering commitment to combining good science &amp; good business.<br>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><div>Digital Intelligence
</div><div>Data Scientist &ndash; Applied Machine Learning</div>
<div>JPMorgan Chase Consumer and Community Banking (CCB) serves 50 million customers with a broad range of consumer financial services, including personal banking, investment advice, small business lending, mortgages, credit cards, payments and auto financing. Our 160,000 employees serve our customers by following Chase's Five Keys to A Great Customer Experience.<br>
<br>
As a JPMorgan Chase &amp; Co employee, you'll be part of a company that makes a real difference every day for our customers, our communities and ourselves. With a focus on customer service, you'll put others first, do what's right and create solutions that make lives better. We invite you to build your career on our strong foundation and help shape what's next - for you and for us.</div>
<div>At JPMorgan Chase &amp; Co, we have undertaken an aggressive digital transformation initiative, which builds on the success of our current mobile and online service offerings. We are investing in innovative ways to deepen customer engagement, satisfaction and profitability through the use of digital channels. The ambition is to position Chase as the undisputed leader in digital financial services and payments, and to enable delivery of highly personalized, real-time experiences that customers increasingly expect. To achieve this, we are currently recruiting a world-class team to build out our next-generation digital platform and capabilities. We think of ourselves as a start-up within the firm and we are building many capabilities from scratch using the latest technologies</div>
<div>Digital Intelligence Data Scientist &ndash; Applied Machine Learning</div>
<div>The Digital Intelligence team turns the firm&rsquo;s billions of credit and debit transactions, clickstream events, and other datasets, into useful insights and proprietary data products to deeply personalize the digital experience of our millions of customers. Whether it&rsquo;s building a social media-style graph of our consumers and merchants, optimizing ad targeting on Chase.com/paid-media search, recommending the most relevant hotels on our rewards website or detecting fraudulent behavior in our digital platform, we work at the intersection of statistics, machine learning, artificial intelligence and engineering to tackle some of the most challenging and interesting problems you will find in digital banking, targeting, commerce and payment. Many companies claim that they have &ldquo;big data&rdquo;. We live and breathe it every day.
</div><div>We are currently looking for a data scientist who is passionate about solving real-world business problems using Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence techniques. You will be designing, developing and deploying large-scale Machine Learning systems using our rich online and offline datasets and a wide variety of big data tools.
</div><div>This is not a role for everyone and we have a high bar. We are looking for those select few who thrive in a dynamic environment, have big ideas and goals, and believe in testing ideas rather than talking about them. They pride themselves at being curious and generalists, able to tackle any problem that comes their way. They love building data products and production-grade models without needing an army of engineers, and love learning new skills along the way. They feel comfortable working with a diverse group of colleagues, e.g. designers, product managers, business analysts and engineers. You will be joining one of the most elite data science teams we have assembled on Wall Street: several of us have worked at Internet and start-up companies before joining the team. You will work on some of the most fascinating and challenging problems, work with the latest technologies, and will enjoy working with colleagues who are just as passionate and curious as you.</div>
<ul><li><div>Masters expected, PhD preferred in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence</div></li>
<li>2+ years of industry experience in building large scale end-to-end machine learning systems using a combination of big data tools and programming languages like Scala, Java and/or Python</li>
<li>Knowledge of parallel and distributed computing frameworks such as Hadoop, Spark, MPI, using GPUs
</li><li><div>Experience in machine learning areas such as recommender systems, NLP, pattern recognition, predictive modeling, Artificial Intelligence</div></li>
<li><div>Experience implementing machine learning algorithms such as support vector machines, decision trees, logistic regression, clustering, neural networks, graphical models etc., or extending open-source libraries such as Mahout, Spark MlLib, GraphLab etc.</div></li>
<li><div>You are curious, have a research mindset, love bringing logic and structure to loosely defined unstructured problems and ideas.</div></li>

<br>---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
<br><br>
As a recognized leader in disciplined agile and lean software development practices, Pivotal combines the Silicon Valley state of mind, modern approach, and infrastructure with organizations’ core expertise and values. Our cloud-native platform and suite of data tools drive software innovation for many of the world’s most admired brands, helping enterprises move at start-up speeds and with greater business agility. We optimize for change and teach next-generation developers to create and build new solutions, and are committed to open source and open standards.

<br><br>
You
<br>---

Us

Your Day

<li>Creating reusable implementations of statistical tests and models using the available technologies in the Pivotal ecosystem</li>
<li>Working with the academic and business community to develop new techniques and to contribute to research in the area of advanced analytics on large databases</li>
<li>Generating new product requirements for the Pivotal engineering group to enhance the analytics capabilities of the database</li>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">We are seeking a Data Scientist to join our team in NYC!
<br><br>
Integral Ad Science (IAS) is a global technology and data company that builds verification, optimization, and analytics solutions to empower the advertising industry to effectively influence consumers everywhere, on every device. We solve the most pressing problems for brands, agencies, publishers, and technology companies by verifying that every impression has the opportunity to be effective, optimizing towards opportunities to consistently improve results, and analyzing digital’s impact on consumer actions. Built on data science and engineering, IAS is headquartered in New York with global operations in ten countries. Our growth and innovation have been recognized in Inc. 500, Crain’s Fast 50, Forbes America’s Most Promising Companies, and I-COM’s Smart Data Marketing Technology Company. IAS was also named to Crain’s Best Places to Work in NYC for four years running, Great Companies to Work For in NYS, and AdAge's list of Best Places to Work in the US.
<br><br>
The Data Science team at Integral is a high profile team that is a center of innovation for the company and a major contributor to the company’s core products. The types of challenges we solve have attracted people from industry and academia with diverse backgrounds, ranging from machine learning, physics, biology, neuroscience, and computer science to finance and economics. We’re passionate about maintaining an open and collaborative environment, where team members bring their own unique style of thinking and tools to the table.
<br><br>
<b>Responsibilities:</b><br>
-----------------
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Work on challenging fundamental data science problems in online advertising</li>
<li>Propose and develop solutions independently and leading a group of other data scientists</li>
<li>Prepare white papers, scientific publications and conference presentations</li>
<li>Work closely with product and engineering teams to identify and answer important product questions</li>
<li>Communicate findings to product managers and engineers</li>
<li>Drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources</li>
<li>Analyze and interpret the results</li>
<li>Develop best practices for instrumentation and experimentation and communicate those to product engineering teams</li>
</ul>
<b>Requirements:</b><br>
-------------
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Ph.D. in a relevant technical (machine learning, computer science, physics, mathematics, statistics, or related field), or 4+ years experience in a relevant role</li>
<li>Extensive experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches using machine learning methods</li>
<li>Track record of using advanced statistical methods, information retrieval, data mining techniques</li>
<li>Comfort manipulating and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources</li>
<li>A strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data</li>
<li>A flexible analytic approach that allows for results at varying levels of precision</li>
<li>Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear, precise, and actionable manner</li>
<li>Fluency with at least one scripting language such as Python</li>
<li>Familiarity with relational databases and SQL</li>
<li>Expert knowledge of an analysis tool such as R or Matlab</li>
<li>Experience working with large data sets, experience working with distributed computing tools a plus (Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, HBase, etc.)</li>
</ul>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Our Industry: Where we play<br>
Medidata is making a real difference in the lives of patients everywhere by accelerating critical drug and medical device development. Our work ensures that life-saving drugs and medical devices get to market faster. We are a certified &ldquo;Great Place to Work&rdquo; with highly engaged employees focused on improving the health outcomes of patients across the globe.<br>
<br>
We develop cloud-based enterprise products and services and are a world leader driving the convergence of the Technology and Life Sciences industries, one of the most exciting areas for innovation globally. With annual revenue in 2016 of nearly $500 million, we are publicly traded (MDSO) with over 850 customers and customer retention rates above 99%. The Medidata Clinical Cloud&reg; is the primary technology solution powering clinical trials for 18 of the world's top 25 global pharmaceutical companies and is used by 18 of the top 25 medical device developers&mdash;from study design and planning through execution, management and reporting. Our customers include global pharmaceutical companies, biotech, diagnostic and device firms, leading academic medical centers, technical partners and contract research organizations.<br>
<br>
By automating over 12,000 clinical trials to date, Medidata has the largest collection of clinical trial data in the world. Today, Medidata pioneers innovative, advanced applications and intelligent data analytics, bringing a new level of quality and efficiency to clinical trials. That means better treatments reach waiting patients sooner.<br>
<br>
We know that diverse teams win. It is our diversity and inclusiveness that fuels innovation and sparks our passion and commitment to patient health. We are still led by our Co-founders, Tarek Sherif and Glen de Vries, and have global operations in US, Europe and Asia with over 1900 employees.<br>
<br>

<br>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p><b>We&rsquo;re working to change the way wealth is created.</b>

YieldStreet connects investors to opportunities in alternative asset classes like real estate and litigation finance that were historically unavailable to most. YieldStreet was created because our founders were frustrated by the lack of options regular investors had to participate in asset backed investment opportunities that exist outside of the stock market.
<br>
We believe top notch technology and data can help us build the world&rsquo;s most robust alternative investment platform and create financial independence for all. Join us.</p>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">The Mayor's Office of Data Analytics (MODA) is New York City s ideas incubator for operational analytics. MODA collaborates with City agencies to deliver measurable improvements to City services. The work touches virtually every urban issue, including safety, physical infrastructure, economic development, social services, and quality of life. Depending on the needs of the City in different situations, MODA plays the role of strategic advisor, analyst, technical resource, and data advocate to a host of internal and external clients and partners. The successful candidate will serve as a Data Scientist reporting to the Mayor's Office of Data Analytics (MODA). The mission of MODA is to deliver actionable insight and quantitative support to New York City through data analytics. Responsibilities will include, but will typically entail producing quantitative analysis to support on-going projects, agency-specific pilot programs, requests from senior City officials, and other duties as assigned by the Chief Analytics Officer; manipulate and analyze technical data from city agencies in order to predict outcomes and prioritize inspection and audit resources; apply statistical and data mining techniques to conduct fraud detection, trend analysis, and predictive analytics using acquired data; collaborate with team members to develop novel strategies for technical analysis; develop detailed methodologies in order to allow successful projects to be transferred and automated by client agencies; and create and present compelling reports to stakeholders based upon project findings and methods.
<br><br>
Minimum Qual Requirements
<br><br>
1. A baccalaureate degree from an accredited college and two years of experience in community work or community centered activities in an area related to the duties described above; or 2. High school graduation or equivalent and six years of experience in community work or community centered activities in an area related to the duties as described above; or 3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least one year of experience as described in "1" above.
<br><br>
Preferred Skills
<br><br>
<b>The successful candidate should possess the following:</b> Strong quantitative and problem-solving skills; experience with empirical methods and data analytics including working with large, complex micro - data sets, building applied statistics or econometrics models, and/or conducting research; ability to problem solve, while balancing competing priorities, complex situations and tight deadlines; ability to think outside of the box and develop novel strategies for analysis; ability to distill complex material into actionable recommendations; excellent written and oral communication skills; energetic and resourceful, organized and results-oriented; self-starter and team player; comfortable interfacing with senior management and stakeholders; proficiency in SAS, STATA, SQL, R, SPSS (and/or other statistical software), ArcGJS (or other GIS programs), Python or other programming languages; interest in New York City policy and operations.

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p><b>Summary of Research:</b></p>
<p>The candidate will work in a multi-disciplinary team in Sema4 and Mount Sinai and contribute significantly to our efforts to systematically study complex human diseases through the integration of genomic, genetic, epigenetic, proteomic, literature and clinical phenotypic data into network models or other machine learning models. The goal of this research is to model mechanisms underlying human diseases and represent them in probabilistic graphical models. Such models will be used to guide drug target discovery and prioritization, to develop combination therapies, to reposition existing drugs, to match individual patients to the best therapies, and more.
</p><p><b>Responsibilities:</b></p>
<p>The person in this position will be responsible for developing novel mathematic models for integrating diverse data sources, and/or mining existing network models for disease specific features.
</p><p><b>Requirements:</b></p>
<p>Education:</p>
<p>The ideal candidate for this position should have strong analytic background and a Ph.D. degree in quantitative sciences such as physics, mathematics, statistics, computer science, electronic engineering, bioinformatics.
</p><p>Years of Experience:</p>

About Payfone
<br><br>

<br><br>
Payfone delivers seamless, non-intrusive verification using each mobile phone’s inherent identity to provide top-tier protection for businesses and their customers.
<br><br>
Remove friction and drive user engagement with Payfone Instant Trust. It’s the best way to enhance the customer experience while lowering risk, friction and fraud.

Summary:<br>

About this role:
</p><p>This role creates thought leading research in the context of data security, which includes data security governance, data access and control, data protection technologies as well as information-centric protection for our IT Leaders clients through publications, conversations with clients (Inquiry), stage presentations, teleconferences, and client meetings. <span id="job_summary" class="summary">Known for its scientific and operational excellence, Regeneron is a leading science-based biopharmaceutical company that discovers, invents, develops, manufactures, and commercializes medicines for the treatment of serious medical conditions. Regeneron commercializes medicines for eye diseases, high LDL-cholesterol, atopic dermatitis and a rare inflammatory condition and has product candidates in development in other areas of high unmet medical need, including rheumatoid arthritis, asthma, pain, cancer and infectious diseases.<br>
<br>
This person will be working in the Target Information Group in Tarrytown, NY. While many research organizations are involved in drug discovery, the Target Information Group (TIG) seeks to leverage its unique skills and utilize both public and proprietary information to identify new drug target opportunities. The student will help contribute to this effort by building on our understanding of disease mechanisms and drug targets through extensive data mining and analytics application development. Working with the TIG team and therapeutic focus area scientists, the intern will identify a topic of interest to both intern and research staff and will utilize a variety of public and commercial data mining tools and databases to assemble information on protein targets and/or drug target families, update corporate knowledge databases with relevant biological information/links and create customized data visualization dashboards. The student will be responsible for searching, assembling and archiving information on drug targets., disease biology and current therapies, and will create materials that facilitate communication of their findings to all research areas of the company. At the conclusion of the project, the intern will review their findings for company scientists.<br>
<br>
Start building your skills at Regeneron.<br>
<ul><li>Must be an undergraduate, graduate, or PhD student</li><li>Must be pursuing a degree in molecular biology, biochemistry, genetics, or bioinformatics, or have a demonstrated career interest in biological sciences or medicine.</li><li>Experience with Windows OS, database or spreadsheet applications, word processing and/or image processing is desirable</li><li>Experience with public biological databases (such as NCBI, PubMed, OMIM) and/or familiarity with Excel, SharePoint, scripting languages or similar software would be preferred.</li><li>Must have good organizational and numeracy skills.</li></ul><br>
<br>
General Intern Program Information:<br>
<ul><li>Must be enrolled in, or accepted to, an academic program pursuing a Bachelor's, Master's, PhD or PharmD</li><li>Summer Program is full-time (~40 hrs/wk) for at least 10 weeks and is paid</li><li>Prefer demonstrated leadership in areas such as campus activities, clubs, sports or the community</li><li>Minimum GPA of 3.0</li><li>You will work with a specific manager on a project(s)</li><li>Enjoy weekly 1 hour Intern Program events: learn about other areas of the company from VPs and other employees, soft skills workshops, networking, volunteering, and more!</li><li>Present to your team on your summer project</li></ul><br>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p>The CCQ seeks highly motivated data scientists with a strong background in computational physics methods and software development. Depending on levels of experience, positions may be at-will Data Scientists or term-appointment Associate Data Scientists.
</p><p>These positions will report to a group leader or project leader and will be responsible for developing the core library and algorithms for CCQ software libraries, which are currently ITensor (http://itensor.org/) and TRIQS ( https://triqs.ipht.cnrs.fr/) . These positions also support the associated scientific community by creating documentation, responding to user questions, and addressing bug reports. A Data Scientist may be expected to provide training through lectures and tutorials at the Institute and external activities such as summer schools. </h2><div><div><div><p>Everyday Health, Inc. is a leading provider of digital health marketing and communications solutions. We are seeking a Data Scientist to join the EH Consumer team!</p>

Who We Are:<br>
Ziff Davis, a subsidiary of j2 Global, Inc., is a leading global digital-media company operating in four core verticals: Technology, Gaming, Healthcare and Shopping. Its brands &ndash; PCMag, Speedtest, ExtremeTech, Geek, Toolbox, IGN, Everyday Health, AskMen, Offers.com, TechBargains, emedia and Salesify &ndash; produce and distribute premium content across multiple platforms and devices. Ziff Davis delivers advertising, performance marketing, data services and licensing solutions to thousands of clients worldwide. Ziff Davis publishes in 25 languages and successfully partners with local publishing operators across 114 countries.</p><p>
Everyday Health, Inc., a wholly-owned subsidiary of Ziff Davis, LLC, is a leading provider of digital health marketing and communications solutions. Everyday Health attracts a large and engaged audience of over 46 million consumers and over 730,000 practicing physicians in the U.S. to its premier health and wellness properties, and utilizes its data and analytics expertise to deliver highly personalized content experiences and efficient and effective marketing and engagement solutions. Everyday Health enables consumers to manage their daily health and wellness needs, healthcare professionals to stay informed and make better decisions for their patients, and marketers, health payers and providers to communicate and engage with consumers and healthcare professionals to drive better health outcomes. Everyday Health&rsquo;s content and solutions are delivered through multiple channels, including desktop, mobile web, and mobile phone and tablet applications, as well as video and social media.</p><p>
What We Offer:</p><p>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p>Quartz seeks a data scientist to help us improve with data. This position will lead data collection and analysis for all of our products, helping the product and editorial teams make better-informed decisions and optimize their efforts to serve and grow Quartz&rsquo;s audience.</p>
<p>We have a diverse array of products with rich usage data and interesting challenges: QZ.com, our flagship website; the Quartz Daily Brief and four other popular emails; apps for iOS and Android; Atlas, a user-generated charted platform; and more. These are created by a talented group of designers, engineers, and product managers with whom you would work every day. And you would do it all within a forward-thinking newsroom that puts its users first and foremost.</p>
<p><b>The Data Scientist will:</b></p>
<ul><li>analyze key questions about our products and their users;</li>
<li>know the questions we should be asking of our data;</li>
<li>implement a variety of algorithms (e.g. supervised and unsupervised machine learning, Bayesian MCMC) to support important product decisions</li>
<li>develop models for data collection in our products;</li>
<li>proactively study our data for new insights</li>
</ul><p>Yes, it&rsquo;s a big job! And it&rsquo;s a new role for us, though you won&rsquo;t be on your own in working with data at Quartz. You would be joining our analytics team, which consists of several analysts, data engineers, and a product scientist. And we have robust tracking on most of our existing products, which means you&rsquo;d have rich data with which to work on day one.</p>
<p>To be successful in this job, you will of course need experience as a data scientist, product analyst, or something similar. And we also expect you will bring technical skills to the role: proficiency with big data cloud solutions and open source analytic tools. Experience with Python (Pandas and Scikit-Learn) is preferred, though we don&rsquo;t insist on a particular language. It&rsquo;s important that you can analyze and visualize data on your own.</p>
<p>Previous experience in media isn&rsquo;t crucial, but it could definitely help. Regardless, you should have a strong interest in Quartz&rsquo;s work and the many ways in which digital journalism products are different from other kinds of products. Most importantly, you should be a voice for the value of data and importance of rigorous analysis in a newsroom environment.</p>
<p>This job reports to the director of analytics. Candidates who can work in our New York office are strongly preferred, since our entire product team is located there, but we&rsquo;ll consider applications from other locations. Please include with your application a cover letter and, if at all possible, a sample of your work in data science (github repo, a report, or other indication of what you can do).</p>
<p><b>Atlantic Media Values:</b></p>
<p>Across Atlantic Media, generally, the firm looks for two &ldquo;pillar gifts&rdquo; in its candidates. In all of us, these are more aspirational than actual, but they are central in our intentions.</p>
<ul><li><b>Force of Ideas: </b>At the center of Atlantic Media work are the ideas within our writing. We believe that ideas &ndash; to the good and not &ndash; have consequence. Our highest work is bringing rigor, insight, intellectual honesty, to that ultimate purpose of separating the bad from the good, giving voice, argument, and flight to the latter.</li>
<li><b>Spirit of Generosity</b>: Atlantic Media seeks in its ranks a spirit of generosity &ndash; a natural disposition in each colleague toward service and selfless conduct. Atlantic Media writing should be cut from the same cloth &ndash; critical on the merits but informed by charity and forbearance in measuring motive and personal character.</li></ul>
<p>Atlantic Media is an EOE of Minorities/Women/Vets/Disability.</p></span><br><div id="p_d64adcc91feaa30d">

<h2 class="jobSectionHeader">Who You'll Work With
</h2>You’ll work with our Healthcare Analytics & Delivery team based in several office locations. Healthcare Analytics & Delivery is part of McKinsey’s New Ventures.
<br>
<br>
The Healthcare Analytics & Delivery team uses healthcare data (payer / provider / 3rd party data) and analytics to answer some of the most pressing questions our healthcare clients have today such as “How do we manage cost of care while improving quality?”, “How do we remain competitive in the evolving healthcare landscape?”, “Who are the most vulnerable patients and what interventions can we design to better care for them?”.
<br>
<br>
Our capabilities are foundational to multiple high profile initiatives and have been core to the Healthcare practice in delivering organization wide transformation programs for payors (public and private) or providers. The team has grown to 200+ colleagues globally over the last 4 years. It is a unique mix of Healthcare Experts, physicians, statisticians, engineers, data scientists, and more.
<br>
<br>
New Ventures fosters innovation driven by analytics, design thinking, mobile and social by developing new products and services and and integrating them into our client work. It is helping to shift our medel toward asset-based consulting and is a foundation for—and expands our investment in—our entrepreneurial culture. Through innovative software as a service solutions, strategic acquisitions, and a vibrant ecosystem of alliances, we are redefining what it means to work with McKinsey.
<br>
<br>
<h2 class="jobSectionHeader">What You'll Do
</h2>You will be an important contributor to the success of any Healthcare Analytics & Delivery projects by participating in the problem-solving effort to design, deliver and maintain one or more models or algorithms.
<br>
<br>
You will deliver the necessary analysis to inform the problem-solving process by chrystalizing and documenting the designed models and algorithms (typically in a comprehensive Detailed Business Requirement document). You will work with our Technology team to turn the model and algorithms into an actual production grade code developed on the Big Data Platform.
<br>
<br>
You’ll have the opportunity to develop an expertise on at least one Healthcare Analytics asset (e.g., a specific model or a specific episode of care). You’ll also participate in IP development projects, contributing to the overall knowledge and capabilities of Healthcare Analytics. Additionally, you’ll develop a strong knowledge base related to healthcare payment innovation (e.g., Episode-based payment models, PCMH, ACO, Health Homes, Capitation models) and of claims data (e.g., ICD-9 codes, CPT codes, pharmacy claims coding). You will be involved in working with multiple clients and assets at the same time, and may be responsible for managing a project autonomously.
<br>
<br>
Flexibility exists to hire at the junior analyst, analyst, or senior analyst level depending on a candidate’s experience and related expertise. Those hired as senior analysts who perform exceptionally well can expect to subsequently be promoted to the specialist level.

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Known for its scientific and operational excellence, Regeneron is a leading science-based biopharmaceutical company that discovers, invents, develops, manufactures, and commercializes medicines for the treatment of serious medical conditions. Regeneron commercializes medicines for eye diseases, high LDL-cholesterol, atopic dermatitis and a rare inflammatory condition and has product candidates in development in other areas of high unmet medical need, including rheumatoid arthritis, asthma, pain, cancer and infectious diseases.
<br>
<br>
Summary
<br>
Seeking a highly motivated individual to join the Oncology team and contribute to the development of novel therapeutics in the field of immuno-oncology. The successful candidate will be responsible for applying histologic techniques and image analysis to better understand the tumor microenvironment and inform our clinical programs. Identification of potential biomarkers and supporting companion diagnostic assays for novel therapeutic targets and agents are included in the scope of this position.
<br>

Responsibilities
<br>
• Apply expertise in Immunology, Cancer Biology and/or the Tumor Microenvironment to support pre-clinical and clinical projects
<br>

<br>

<br>
• Work with pathology, precision medicine and research teams to identify and validate biomarkers, using immunohistochemistry, RNA in situ hybridization and other techniques
<br>
• Collaborate with Image analysis group, Pathology, Sample Management and Precision Medicine groups to develop image analysis algorithms across different tissue staining platforms
<br>
• Identify novel cancer targets using various resources, including scientific literature, patents, bioinformatics databases, knowledge based tools and input from consultants and clinicians
<br>
• Explore multiplex imaging modalities with the potential to apply to clinical sample analyses

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><div><b>The Mount Sinai Health System</b></div>
<p><b>Do you have what it takes to wear the badge?</b></p>
<p>The Mount Sinai Health System's commitment to excellence extends beyond delivering world-class health care. The System's ongoing success is dependent upon our highly motivated, nonclinical professionals working to improve business operations. Our leadership team is driven to provide exceptional service by cultivating a workforce that is dedicated to upholding Mount Sinai's mission of delivering innovative, breakthrough medicine with compassion and integrity.</p>
<p>Are you ready to discover the world of limitless possibilities that comes with wearing the badge? Explore more about this opportunity and how you can help us write a new chapter in our story of unrivaled patient care!</p>
<p>Mount Sinai, one of the leading US health systems with a top-ranked academic medical center, medical school and faculty practice is accelerating a transition to a business model based on population health by launching Mount Sinai Health Partners (MSHP), a new 350+ employee team dedicated to making Mount Sinai the best population health manager in New York.
</p><p>MSHP is realizing this new objective in two ways. First, we engage in value-based contracts with health plans. Using analytical insights, we deploy our clinical programs to improve the health of attributed populations and maximize customer value. Second, we assemble our clinical services into 3 new product offerings &ndash; specialty care bundles, worksite clinics, and insurance products in partnership with payers.
</p><p>To support these strategies, we are hiring an analytics team comprised of talented analysts and data scientists that are passionate about developing a true system of care that creates value for our customers and patients.</p>
<div><b>What You'll Do:</b></div>
<li>You will design and implement data-driven insights to <b>enable value-based contracts and commercial offerings</b>. You will <b>support the contract lifecycle</b> from initial development and planning, through pre-sale and implementation, to reconciliation.
</li><ul><li>During planning phase: analyze variance to identify opportunities and risks; <b>develop pro-forma scenario models of contracts and terms</b>; create reports to guide negotiations with prospects</li><li>
During implementation: <b>forecast performance results</b> and support client-specific areas of interest</li><li>
During reconciliation: measure performance of our products across financial, patient satisfaction, and quality outcomes. <b>Apply performance evaluation that fulfills contract terms</b> and, when appropriate, the demands of rigorous outcomes research methodology.</li><li>
Work with departmental staff to identify requirements for reporting and / or business intelligence tools.</li><li>
Identify necessary data and methodologies; collect, integrate, analyze and interpret data.</li><li><b>
Leverage advanced statistical analysis methods to create insightful recommendations</b> and conclusions that you effectively communicate to your stakeholders.</li><li>
Identify and address expected and unforeseen data complexities to mitigate their impact on the analytic outcome and associated business decisions. Clearly communicate data issues to the recipients and work to improve data quality where possible within the analytical models you create. Feed data quality issues back to IT to assist in our quest for high quality data.</li><li>
Develop and present reports, analyses and findings to senior management and others as scheduled or requested.</li></ul>
<li>You will engage with the MSHP Managed Care Contracting and Commercialization teams and interface with key leaders in our care management and clinical service lines.</li>
<li>Act as liaison/analyst for internal stakeholders, understand their needs and translate them into reporting and analytic solutions.</li>
<div><b>What You'll Bring:</b></div>
<ul><li>Minimum of BA/BS degree in a relevant field of study; Master's degree preferred.</li><li>
At least two (2) years of analytics development experience for a health provider, health plan or accountable care organization including either:</li><li>
Experience working in a health plan or consulting actuarial, financial reporting or medical economics departments or
</li><li>Experience working in healthcare provider analytics related to managed care contracting, population management, clinical or financial decision support
</li><li>At least five (5) years of experience to be considered for level II</li><li>
At least ten (10) years of experience to be considered for level III</li><li>
PhD, MD or DO program may be substituted for 3 years of experience</li><li>
Strong data mining skills using tools like SQL, R, Python, SAS, etc.</li><li>
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to perform complex analysis and make recommendations based on statistical inferences. Experience with a wide variety of analytical or statistical methods.</li><li>
Strong working knowledge of Business Intelligence products (Tableau, SAS, MicroStrategy, etc.)</li><li>
Excellent oral and writing skills; ability to communicate effectively with varying audiences.</li><li>
Demonstrated ability to articulate goals, plan and implement processes to achieve those goals, recognize and assess the implications of confounding variables, and meet deadlines.</li><li>
Advanced interpersonal (e.g., mediating, mentoring, teaching) skills required to service internal and external clients effectively.</li><li>
Self-motivated with a demonstrated ability to work independently, and to exercise independent judgment in developing complex techniques or programs in a dynamic environment.</li></ul>
<div> </div><p><b>Do you share our dedication to extraordinary service and have what it takes to wear the badge? Apply now!</b></p>
<div><b>Who We Are:</b></div>
<p>Over 35,000 employees strong, the mission of the Mount Sinai Health System is to provide compassionate patient care with seamless coordination and to advance medicine through unrivaled education, research, and outreach in the many diverse communities we serve.</p>
<p>Formed in September 2013, The Mount Sinai Health System combines the excellence of the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai with seven premier hospital campuses, including Mount Sinai Beth Israel, Mount Sinai Beth Israel Brooklyn, The Mount Sinai Hospital, Mount Sinai Queens, Mount Sinai Roosevelt, Mount Sinai St. Luke's, and New York Eye and Ear Infirmary of Mount Sinai.</p>
<p>The Mount Sinai Health System is committed to the tenets of diversity and workforce that are strengthened by the inclusion of and respect for our differences. We offer our employees a highly competitive compensation and benefits package, a 403(b)-retirement plan, and much more.</p>

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Research Scientists at Google work closely with Software Engineers to discover, invent, and build at the largest scale. Ideas may come from internal projects as well as from collaborations with researchers at partner universities and technical institutes all over the world. From creating experiments and prototyping implementations to designing new learning algorithms, Research Scientists work on challenges in machine perception, data mining, machine learning, and natural language understanding. As a Google Research Scientist, you will continue to be an active contributor to the wider research community by collaborating with academic researchers and by publishing papers.
<br>
<br>
Researchers on the Google Brain team have the freedom to set their research agenda and to engage as much or as little as they wish with existing products, choosing between doing more basic, methodological research or more applied research as necessary to produce the most compelling results. Because many of the advances we develop today may take years to become useful, the team as a whole maintains a portfolio of projects across this spectrum. It is our philosophy that making substantive progress on hard applications can help drive and sharpen the research questions we study, and in turn scientific breakthroughs can spawn entirely new applications.
<br>
<br>
The Google Brain team’s research focuses on methods that can learn multiple layers of rich, non-linear feature extractors and can scale to large amounts of data. Much of our work is best understood as part of the deep learning subfield of machine learning, but we are interested in any methods capable of efficient and effective feature learning that get good results on challenging problems. We have resources and access to projects impossible to find elsewhere. Our broad and fundamental research goals allow us to collaborate closely with and–contribute uniquely to–many different product teams across the company.
<br>
<br>

</h2><ul><li>Participate in cutting edge research in machine intelligence and machine learning applications.
</li><li>Develop solutions for real world, large scale problems.
</li></ul><br>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><b>Position:</b> Data Scientist - Machine Learning
<br><b>Location:</b> Stamford, CT
<br><b>Compensation:</b> $90,000 - $170,000 + Bonus + Excellent Benefits + Paid Relocation
<br><br>
<b>Job Description:</b><br>
This Client is a financial-technology company with an outstanding reputation for technological innovation, has 40 years of success in developing trading systems and tools for the securities market.
<br>This is a new position for a smart, hands-on data scientist capable of providing technical leadership to anchor an internal specialty for data analytics.
<br>You will have strong skills in machine learning, data sourcing, and data mining as well as the leadership skills to coalesce current internal activities into a focused specialty.
<br>You will manage the life-cycle of data collection and research-focused projects.
<br><br>
<b>Responsibilities:</b><br>
Analyze patterns in complex data sets, define product and source usage and develop recommendations to expand services and leverage continued corporate growth.
<br>Identify information needs based around current products and services and track how they are being used by current customers.
<br>Manage the life-cycle of data collection and research-focused projects.
<br>Provide recommendations which drive advancements in software products and services.
<br>Design and improve internal data collection and database designs to optimize efficiency and improve the data quality.
<br>Work closely with senior management to prioritize business and strategic objectives using a data-driven approach.
<br>Identify additional data sources to be used to enhance current data sets and improve analysis.
<br>Maximize self-directed and independent work, planning and managing the life-cycle of data collection and research-focused projects.
<br><br>
<b>Qualifications:</b><br>
PhD or Masters in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering or similar technical field.
<br>Experience with machine learning and statistical languages such as Python or R for analyzing large, complex datasets.
<br>Experience researching multiple data sources and the ability to assess value and productively of new data sources, making recommendations to senior management.
<br>5-8 years of experience in a corporate setting doing complex data analysis.
<br>Experience managing the life-cycle of data collection and research-focused projects.

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><p>As the nation&rsquo;s leading bottled water company, Nestl&eacute; Waters North America is dedicated to providing customers with healthy hydration options. Alongside that, we&rsquo;re also committed to developing our people &ndash; enabling them to make the most of the many elements that help them to succeed.
</p><p>The Nestle Waters North America (&ldquo;NWNA&rdquo;) Co-op program provides opportunities for students to apply classroom methodology to hands-on projects. The student&rsquo;s NWNA co-op advisor, mentor, and the assigned project team coordinate to ensure the learning experience is relevant and challenging.
</p><p><br>
The <b>Data Analytics Co-Op</b> is an exciting opportunity with Nestl&eacute; Waters North America demonstrate and sharpen your analytical skills, to get a hands-on experience in solving real business problems using forecasting techniques and predictive modeling.
</p><p><br>
Throughout the course of your program, you will be working directly with our National Manager, Advanced Analytics/Principal Data Scientist and the business leaders on critical business projects. You will get an opportunity to use top-of-the-line SAS tools for time series forecasting and modeling, and to build and put to use models in R. You will gain hands-on experience solving real business problems and delivering actionable business insight. Our former co-ops and interns were able to land highly competitive jobs in the industry as a result of doing this term with Nestle Waters.</p><p><br>
<b>
The example project areas could include:</b><br>
</p><li>Forecasting: Prepare data for modeling and prototype various modeling approaches to achieve desirable forecast accuracy.
</li><li>Advanced Analytics: Combine/prepare data, data survey, preliminary analysis, and slicing and dicing the data to reveal new business insight.</li><li>
Predictive modeling: Suggest and implement predictive models such as regression, logistic regression, decision trees/random forest, neural nets, etc</li><li>
Build model front end: Use GUI tools (R shiny or Power BI) to consume the model in a dynamic way.</li><p><b>
To be successful in this role the ideal candidate will possess a few of the following technical skills.</b></p><ul><li>
Good working knowledge of base SAS with the ability to write SAS code and macros.</li><li>
Understand statistical concepts and forecasting methodology.
</li><li>Experience with any of SAS tools such as Enterprise Guide, SAS Forecast Studio, Enterprise Miner, SAS ETS/Studio.</li><li>
Knowledge of R and hands-on experience with R. R Shiny development.</li><li>
Any other predictive analytics or forecasting package and a desire to learn SAS or R.</li><li>
Experience in software development.</li></ul><p>
Personal traits:</p><ul><li>
Be a problem-solver, and have the ability to work independently after the direction has been set and agreed upon.</li><li>
A good team player and collaborator.</li><li>
Tenacity &amp; strong drive to learn new things and to finish the projects in timely</li></ul>
<br>
<b>Qualifications</b>
<p><b>In order to be considered for this role, candidates must meet the following requirements:</b></p><ul><li><div>
Must be currently enrolled in a graduate level program pursuing a degree within the field of analytics, applied statistics, software engineering, data mining, econometrics, or engineering.
</div></li><li><div>Must be in good academic standing, with a cumulative GPA of at least 3.0.</div></li><li><div>
Passion for a career in data analytics.
</div></li><li><div>Must be able to work 40 hours per week for a 6 month time period.</div></li></ul><p><b>
NOTE:</b>
</p><ul><li><div>This is a paid co-op program. Students will be paid hourly.
</div></li><li><div>NWNA does not offer relocation or work authorization sponsorship for this program.</div></li></ul><p><b>

Our water brands include Poland Spring, Arrowhead, Ozarka, Deer Park, Zephyrhills and Ice Mountain, Nestl&eacute; Pure Life, S. Pellegrino, Perrier and Acqua Panna. Our tea brand is Nestea. We&rsquo;re passionate about creating shared value for society in all kinds of ways: from providing careers and benefits to communities where we operate to environmental stewardship &ndash; most notably responsible water management, lightweight packaging and advancing recycling in America. As a valuable part of our team, you&rsquo;ll receive a competitive total rewards package &ndash; something that will provide you with the support you need to thrive both inside and outside of work. It&rsquo;s not just the work that you&rsquo;ll find fulfilling here though. Background Information - UNOPS
<br>
<br>
UNOPS supports the
successful implementation of its partners’ peacebuildin...
<br>
<br>
UNOPS supports the
successful implementation of its partners’ peacebuilding, humanitarian and
development projects around the world. Our mission is to serve people in need
by expanding the ability of the United Nations, governments and other partners
to manage projects, infrastructure and procurement in a sustainable and
efficient manner.
<br>
<br>
Working in some of
the world’s most challenging environments, our vision is to advance sustainable
implementation practices, always satisfying or surpassing our partners’
expectations.
<br>
<br>
With over 7,000
personnel spread across 80 countries, UNOPS offers its partners the logistical,
technical and management knowledge they need, wherever they need it.
<br>
<br>
A flexible
structure and global reach means that we can quickly respond to our partners'
needs, while offering the benefits of economies of scale.
<br>
<br>
Background information- ECR
<br>
<br>
Based in Geneva, the Europe and Central Asia Regional Office (ECR) supports UNOP...
<br>
<br>
Based in Geneva, the Europe and Central Asia Regional Office (ECR) supports UNOPS offices throughout the region through: management, financial and programmatic oversight of global and country-specific portfolios, clusters and operations centres, including hosting services; fund and management advisory services; project implementation; procuring goods and services; and managing human resources.
<br>
<br>
ECR ensures that projects are executed to the highest standards, providing a shared knowledge base and ensuring that best practices and lessons learned are disseminated between business units and projects across the entire region.
<br>
<br>
ECR strategy is to:
<br>
<ul><li>Strengthen UNOPS role in operationalizing the Sustainable Development Goals with particular emphasis on health, environment and economic development.
</li><li>Position UNOPS in the Balkan sub-region, the Caucasus and Central Asia.
</li><li>Strengthen the implementation of ECR global and regional programmes, with revitalized partnerships in infrastructure, procurement and project management.
</li></ul>ECR operates global portfolios from offices in Geneva, Brussels and New York, and country-specific programmes from its operations and project centres located in Eastern Europe and Central Asian countries.
<br>
<br>
Background Information - Development Group Cluster
<br>
<br>
Based in the New York, the UNOPS Development Group Cluster supports diverse part...
<br>
<br>
Based in the New York, the UNOPS Development Group Cluster supports diverse partners with their peacebuilding, humanitarian and development operations. For example, within the United Nations Development Programme, the Cluster works with the Bureau for Policy and Programme Support and the Office of South-South Cooperation.
<br>
<br>
The cluster also supports the United Nations Secretariat, as well as a broadening community of other New York-based United Nations organizations in the delivery of project management and implementation services
<br>

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><b>Overview :</b><br>
J.Crew is seeking a Data Scientist with an emphasis on Pricing Analytics to join our team of highly successful predictive analysts. If you have a passion for “wowing” business leaders with exceedingly progressive analytics techniques, working with managers who “get” the work you are doing and support your efforts fully, consistently jumping into assignments focused on innovation rather than “minding the lever” of past projects, working alongside a highly professional and astute team with IT support that’s lightning fast to jump to your aid, then J. Crew is the place for you.
<br><br>
<b>Primary responsibilities include but are not limited to:</b><br>
Econometric Modeling
<br>Utilizing knowledge of econometrics and time-series modeling to develop department and style-level elasticity and promotion response models to inform business decisions
<br>Developing algorithms to help inform and/or optimize decisions around Initial Ticket Price setting, Promotion planning and execution, and Markdown timing and depth
<br>Implement formal modeling processes from end to end including data gathering, data profiling, numerical model building, calibration, cross-validation, putting product into production, etc.
<br>After building the models, pilot “scorecards” to track model performance and calculated improvement to business – including pre/post time-series analyses, and A/B testing where applicable
<br>Explain complex modeling approaches in layman’s terms and discuss modeling results and business case impacts with non-technical business users
<br><br>
Data Munging
<br>Collect data from a wide variety of corporate databases, including various SQL databases, no-SQL databases, Access databases, Big Data and Excel files
<br>Utilize your toolset in regular expressions to extract information from un-structured text documents
<br>Handle missing data through an algorithmic approach such as multiple imputations to enable insights in sparse and messy data.
<br>Use your inner whiz-kid to feature engineer the data to boost model accuracy
<br><br>
Education & Experience Requirements
<br>Master’s degree preferred in statistics, Economics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Engineering, or Mathematics with a strong quantitative background
<br>At least 5 years previous work experience with strong understanding and proficiency of econometric (including focus on price elasticity) and time-series modeling techniques. Machine learning background a plus
<br>Understanding of modeling techniques and specifically logistic regression, linear regression, cluster analysis, CHAID, market basket analysis, etc.
<br>Superior research, statistical, analytical, processing and mathematical skills with ability to structure and conduct analyses
<br>Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, SQL and R and/or Python
<br>Exceptional troubleshooting skills and should thrive in high expectation scenario with many stakeholders
<br>Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to present complex information in an easy-to-understand manner with clear recommendations based on data insight
<br>Strongly motivated to be a player in a team which is constantly working to improve themselves through discovering new analytics techniques and software tools to improve the quality of our work
<br><br>

J.Crew Group, Inc. is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer
