4-6 years of experience applying statistics and/or statistical learning algorithms</li><li>
3-5 years using relational databases and SQL, developing and deploying software to a production environment, and using distributed version control such as Git or Mercurial</li><li>
Understanding of the practical implications of common statistical learning and statistics algorithms</li><li>
2-4 years using a combination of Scikit Learn, Tensorflow, Spark ML, R packages such as arm/gam/glmnet/nlme/sem/etc. or other analytical frameworks</li><li>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">NCS has been helping enterprises staff and deliver business-critical projects for over 30 years. We are business and technology consultants who understand what works when aligning the resources needed for success. NCS provides targeted resources that are productive from day one.
<br><br>
SUMMARY
<br><br>
The Scientific Business Analyst (SBA) will work with Research Scientists and act as a liaison between IT and Research. The SBA interfaces between Research Systems Analysts, Programmers, Data Architects, Scientists, and IT Project Managers to ensure that information technology designs meet the needs of the end users and comply with the comprehensive Research-wide data management plan. The SBA develops user requirements and design plans that incorporate new system solutions into the overall Research systems architecture through documentation of scientific processes, data workflows, and product/service requirements. In addition, SBAs ensure that the solution meets the requirements of the Scientists by engaging the team in an iterative software development cycle. This position requires logical knowledge of existing system capabilities, business process analysis, and requirements documentation in a highly complex scientific environment.
<br><br>
JOB DUTIES
<br><br>
Lead scientific-related business needs assessment, as well as facilitate the design, build and implementation of IT systems. Work with scientists and laboratory personnel to understand their business processes and suggest improvement opportunities to enhance end-user experience
<br>Work closely with end-users and technical team members to translate high-level business and user requirements into functional and design specifications using structured business and technical analysis and data modeling techniques (e.g. activity diagrams, entity-relationship diagrams, etc.)
<br>Act as an expert technical and scientific resource to software development staff in all phases of the development and implementation process
<br>Participate in user research, usability and acceptance testing
<br><br>
JOB REQUIREMENTS
<br><br>
Demonstrated ability to effectively communicate, both verbally and in writing, with members of all levels of the organization
<br>Demonstrated ability to clearly document requirements and processes
<br>Candidate should be able to demonstrate the ability to interact with technical and scientific personnel
<br>Demonstrated ability to perform business analysis, elicit requirements and identify valid improvement opportunities
<br>Ability to understand end-user needs and user experience in a science-based research environment
<br>Willingness to work in and adapt to a fast paced, ever-changing environment
<br><br>
Attention to detail and a passion for solving complex and interesting problems in a science driven environment
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Analytical with the desire to measure the effectiveness of new features</li>
<li>Demonstrated problem solving and analytical skills</li>
<li>Strong interest in contributing to biological research</li>
</ul>
Preferred background
<br><br>
<ul>
<li>Experience with molecular biology laboratory techniques and bioinformatics methods</li>
<li>Solid foundational understanding of genetics and genotypic analysis</li>
<li>Additional experience with quantitative PCR a plus</li>
<li>Familiarity with in vivo experiments and data analysis</li>
<li>Experience with optimizing high-throughput plate-based assays or experience programming liquid handling instruments</li>
<li>Understanding of relational database concepts</li>
<li>Understanding of current IT project and software development life cycle processes and methodologies</li>
<li>Graduate degree in a life science with experience in computer science or information technology</li>
<li>Project/Process management experience</li>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><b>Position Overview</b><br>
<br>
At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. As a(n) <b>Quantitative Analytics Analyst Sr.</b> within PNC's <b>Asset and Liabilities Management</b> organization, you will be based in <b>New York City</b>.<p>
This economic modeler will be part of the Quantitative Research and Modeling group within a buy-side CIO team. The incumbent will apply the frontier of economic theory to macroeconomics modeling, forecasting, and developing econometric models. Modeling projects or focus areas may include:
&#61623; </p><p>Develop econometric models such as macroeconomics models and home price models.
&#61623; </p><p>Develop econometric models for Current Expected Credit Loss (CECL).
&#61623; </p><p>Play a key role in annual CCAR/DFAST stress tests.
&#61623; </p><p>Model development, implementation, execution, and model validation
</p><br>
<br>
<b>Job Profile</b><br>
<br>
<ul><li>Independently performs advanced quantitative analyses and model development to drive decision-making by running quantitative strategies. Makes recommendations based on analyses.</li><li>
Analyzes and develops new model frameworks by supporting the line of business. Refines, monitors, and reviews existing models. Conducts on-going communication with model owners and model developers during the course of the review. Works with larger, more complex datasets to create models.</li><li>
Performs quantitative analysis and develops complex reports. Performs qualitative and quantitative assessments of all aspects of models including theoretical aspects, model design and implementation as well as data quality and integrity. Analyzes complex data and associated quantitative analysis. Makes recommendations based on findings from data analytics.</li><li>
Uses quantitative tools and techniques to measure and analyze model risks and reaches conclusions on strengths and limitations of the model.</li><li>
Prepares and analyzes detailed documents for validation and regulatory compliance, using applicable templates.</li></ul><p>
</p><br>

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary"><b>Position:</b> Data Analytics / Data Sourcing Specialist - Financial Services or Banking
<br><b>Location:</b> Stamford, CT
<br><b>Compensation:</b> $130,000 - $170,000 + Bonus + Excellent Benefits + Paid Relocation
<br><br>
<b>Job Description:</b><br>
This Client is a mid-sized, highly successful financial-technology company with an outstanding reputation for technological innovation.
<br>They seek a smart, self-directed Data Scientist / Data Sourcing Specialist who will work as an individual-contributor, analyzing existing and potential data sources and trends in complex internal data sets to develop recommendations for leveraging these trends to provide improved software and services for their worldwide customer base.
<br>The company offers long-term stability, interesting, challenging work and exceptional compensation potential.
<br><br>
<b>Responsibilities:</b><br>
Evaluate existing data sources and research/expand these to include the most effective sources to support strategic business and marketing objectives.
<br>Analyze patterns in complex data sets, define product usage and develop recommendations to expand services to leverage continued corporate growth.
<br>Identify information needs based around current products and services and track how they are being used by current customers.
<br>Design and improve internal data collection and database designs to optimize efficiency and improve the data quality.
<br>Work closely with management to prioritize business and strategic objectives using a data-driven approach.
<br>Identify additional data sources that can be used to enhance current data sets and improve analysis.
<br>Maximize self-directed and independent work, planning and managing the life-cycle of data collection and research-focused projects.
<br><br>

<div class="result-link-bar-container result-link-bar-viewjob">
<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Known for its scientific and operational excellence, Regeneron is a leading science-based biopharmaceutical company that discovers, invents, develops, manufactures, and commercializes medicines for the treatment of serious medical conditions. Regeneron commercializes medicines for eye diseases, high LDL-cholesterol, atopic dermatitis and a rare inflammatory condition and has product candidates in development in other areas of high unmet medical need, including rheumatoid arthritis, asthma, pain, cancer and infectious diseases.<br>
<br>
<br>
Summary Position:<br>
<br>
We are looking for a Research Associate in our screening/genotyping labs. The primary responsibility will be to perform TaqMan q-PCR based assays in support of our genotyping pipeline. Our screening platform is highly automated and high-throughput. The candidate will also participate in our technology development efforts, such as analyzing cutting-edge CRISPR-Cas9 assisted projects, helping to develop and improve automated methods, and presenting data to various other groups throughout Velocigene and Regeneron.
<br>
<br>
Job duties<br>
<br>
Essential duties and responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:<br>
<br>
Perform experiments utilizing state-of-the-art molecular technologies (primarily TaqMan-based qPCR.)<br>
Isolate DNA using robotic methods<br>
Provide advanced data analysis.<br>
Organize and compile results into a finished format for presentation.<br>
Maintain precise lab notebooks.<br>
Maintain scientific curiosity and familiarity with current advances in transgenic and genome engineering technologies and literature, and apply such knowledge toward development of new or improved technologies.<br>
<br>
#LI-CB1<br>
<br>
<br>
<br>
Job requirements<br>
<br>
This position requires a minimum of a BA/BS in biology, molecular biology, or biochemistry with 3-5 years of experience, or a Master&rsquo;s degree with 1-3 years of experience. In addition, we require:<br>
<br>
Understanding and hands on knowledge of molecular biology and recombinant DNA technology and a good understanding of genetics is essential.<br>
Experience in the area of genome engineering including nuclease-assisted targeting methods, such as CRISPR-Cas9 technology.<br>
Ability to work collaboratively is crucial<br>
Preferred computer skills include: MS Office, database management.<br>
Strong organization and communication skills.<br>
Ability to learn new technologies.<br>
Experience and knowledge of basic bioinformatics methods, such as DNA sequence analysis and comparison, database searching, vector construction and primer design preferred but not required.<br>
<br>
Level will be commensurate with experience<br>
<br>
About VelociGene<br>
<br>
To exploit the power of mouse genetics to unlock the function of each gene in the genome, Regeneron scientists developed VelociGene&reg;, a novel, proprietary group of technologies for the modification of the mouse genome.<br>
Eliminating or modifying a single gene in the mouse genome can provide insight into the role that gene plays in normal physiology and disease pathogenesis. The high-throughput of the automated VelociGene technology enables it to provide, as the name implies, the fastest path from gene discovery to assignment of function. In support of the Regeneron drug development programs, VelociGene has delivered unprecedented speed and capacity for the validation of therapeutic targets and the creation of animal models for human disease. Utilizing VelociGene in conjunction with our VelociMouse&reg; method, Regeneron is able to vastly increase the speed and reduce the cost associated with the generation of genetically engineered mice for understanding the function of each gene.<br>
<br>
The versatile VelociGene technology enables the tackling of projects ranging from a single base mutation to multi-gene deletions and the replacement of mouse genes with their human homologs. The pinnacle of the VelociGene technological achievements was the largest mammalian genetic engineering project ever accomplished: the creation of the VelocImmune&trade; mouse &mdash; a mouse capable of producing human antibodies that can serve as specific and potent therapeutics.<br>
<br>
This is an opportunity to join our select team that is already leading the way in the Pharmaceutical/Biotech industry. Apply today and learn more about Regeneron&rsquo;s unwavering commitment to combining good science &amp; good business.<br>

<div><b>
About Citi:</b></div><div>
Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.</div><div>
Citi&rsquo;s Mission and Value Propositionexplains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients&rsquo; and the public&rsquo;s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.</div><div>
Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop are widely available to all.</div><div><b>
Description:</b></div><div>
Citi Research is searching for a New York based Data Analyst for the Health Care sector. The position is for a Vice President or Director Level. The candidate should have prior experience in data science/analytics, with particular emphasis on surveys, as well as bring strong writing and verbal communication skills. Experience outside the Financial Services industry is preferred, particularly in the Health Care sector.<br>

Coordinate with Citi&rsquo;s innovation lab on more complex big-data projects.</li><li>
Originate ideas for data projects by coordinating with the Health Care team.</li><li>
Contribute commentary on data/analytics to Analyst research reports as required, and publish independently on special projects occasionally.</li><li>
Communicate directly with institutional clients as needed.</li><li>
Assist clients with bespoke projects.</li><li>
Serve as the &ldquo;data champion&rdquo; for the Health Care team, representing the data needs of the Health Care Analysts in discussions with Research Management/Operations.</li><li>
Help manage the inventory of existing and future data sets for the Health Care team.</li><li>
Join the Analysts in branding Citi as a premier provider of data/analytics in Health Care among the bulge bracket firms</li></ul><br>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">The NYC Department of Consumer Affairs (DCA) protects and enhances the daily economic lives of New Yorkers to create thriving communities. DCA licenses more than 81,000 businesses in more than 50 industries and enforces key consumer protection, licensing, and workplace laws that apply to countless more. By supporting businesses through equitable enforcement and access to resources and, by helping to resolve complaints, DCA protects the marketplace from predatory practices and strives to create a culture of compliance. Through its community outreach and the work of its offices of Financial Empowerment and Labor Policy & Standards, DCA empowers consumers and working families by providing the tools and resources they need to be educated consumers and to achieve financial health and work-life balance. DCA also conducts research and advocates for public policy that furthers its work to support New York City?s communities. For more information about DCA and its work, call 311 or visit DCA at nyc.gov/dca or on its social media sites, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.<br>

DCA is seeking a highly skilled Senior Research Analyst with a strong background in assessing data quality, to create regular data reports and bring DCA into compliance with the requirements of NYC?s Open Data Law. <span id="job_summary" class="summary">Known for its scientific and operational excellence, Regeneron is a leading science-based biopharmaceutical company that discovers, invents, develops, manufactures, and commercializes medicines for the treatment of serious medical conditions. Summary:
<br>
Qualified physician or scientist with training in the pharmaceutical/biotechnology sector, or academic or clinical setting. Works closely with supervisor and other members of the cross-functional team, contributes to early development and clinical experimentation for projects for discovery phase through Proof of Concept (POC).
<br>
<br>
Regeneron, has made a major effort in discovery of immunotherapeutics across all disease areas. Results of this research include Aflibercept for age-related macular degeneration, Alirocumab for hyperlipidemia, Dupliumab for atopic dermatitis, Sarilumab for rheumatoid arthritis and Cemiplimab, an anti-PD-1 antibody now in registrational cancer trials.
<br>
<br>
We are committed to advancing our immunotherapeutics using a data-driven approach. Tenable this, ECD&ES are a) conducting clinical experimental studies aimed at state-of-the-art disease tissue profiling analytics, conducted in-house, including DNAseq, RNAseq, in-situ RNA hybridization; b) developing novel antibody-based clinical imaging platforms; c) embedding clinical translationalists into Discovery research teams, to generate clinically testable mechanistic hypotheses for each therapeutic, and design plans to achieve proof of mechanism early in clinical testing, d) designing and executing on informative early development phases, from first-in-human through POC. Our team comprises a small group of clinical scientists. This clinical group reports to the Vice President of Therapeutic Areas within ECD&ES, who reports through the Head of ECD&ES to the Head of Global Clinical Development.

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">The Division of Epidemiology works to improve the health of all New Yorkers through population health surveillance and research, public health workforce development, and vital records services. <br>
<br>
Within the Division, the Special Projects Group works on large-scale population-level research, including citywide health surveys, and using electronic health records for population health surveillance. One important upcoming project is an ambitious longitudinal survey to assess New Yorkers? health over time and the impact of Health Department policies. This longitudinal survey will help the Health Department and its partners develop more effective policies and programming, improving the health of New Yorkers. <br>
<br>
Reporting to the Director of Special Projects in the Division of Epidemiology, the Data Analyst will manage and clean data sets, perform analyses, conduct literature reviews, research best practices in field surveys and specimen collection, write summary documents and articles on research findings, and help plan future studies. <br>
<br>
Duties will include: <br>
<br>
Conduct and summarize literature reviews and research best practices to help develop survey methodology.<br>
<br>
Develop analytic databases, codebooks and documentation, perform investigative analyses, recode variables and create descriptive tables.<br>
<br>
Develop and maintain systems to process health information data files received from external companies contracted to collect health information from study participants. Perform quality assurance techniques accordingly to identify and correct data errors.<br>
<br>
Help develop IRB protocols and help ensure adherence to approval protocols for scientific research.<br>
<br>
Assist with development of data sharing policies and practices to share confidential data files with other collaborators to keep projects in compliance with IRB stipulations and general human subjects research principles.<br>
<br>
Maintain the security of confidentiality data collected to facilitate research projects.<br>
<br>
Prepare written reports summarizing research findings, and present at meetings.<br>
<br>
Draft articles for publications in peer-reviewed journals.<br>
<br>
Perform other duties as assigned.<br>
<br>
.
<br>
<br>
Minimum Qual Requirements
<br>
<br>
1. For Assignment Level I (only physical, biological and environmental sciences and public health) A master's degree from an accredited college or university with a specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological or environmental science or in public health. <br>
To be appointed to Assignment Level II and above, candidates must have: <br>
1. A doctorate degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and one year of full-time experience in a responsible supervisory, administrative or research capacity in the appropriate field of specialization; or <br>
2. A master's degree from an accredited college or university with specialization in an appropriate field of physical, biological, environmental or social science and three years of responsible full-time research experience in the appropriate field of specialization; or <br>
3. Education and/or experience which is equivalent to "1" or "2" above. However, all candidates must have at least a master's degree in an appropriate field of specialization and at least two years of experience described in "2" above. Two years as a City Research Scientist Level I can be substituted for the experience required in "1" and "2" above. <br>
<br>
NOTE: <br>

Appointments to this position are subject to a minimum probationary period of one year.
<br>

<span id="job_summary" class="summary">Vision and Values: </b><br>
Galvanize is a dynamic learning community for technology. Our community is where people and companies with the guts and smarts to create real-world change congregate and inspire each other. Our goal is to make opportunities in technology available to all those with the aptitude, determination and drive. Across our 8 beautifully designed urban campuses, we offer a unique combination of education, workspace, and networking.
<br>
<br>
Galvanize campuses are not simply places to work; they are environments of active engagement, learning and growth. Our Data Science Instructors train technical professionals with programming experience to solve data science problems utilizing innovative educational techniques. We are looking for passionate educators and practical problem solvers with demonstrated flexibility and curiosity. Join us in building the world's hub for education in data science and data engineering.
<br>
<br>
As a Data Science instructor at Galvanize, you will:
<br>
<br>
- Deliver lectures and tutorials on scientific Python, SQL, probability, statistics (Bayesian and frequentist), machine learning, and data engineering. <br>
- Lead our inaugural Nights and Weekends Data Science “immersive” program <br>
- Lead “sprints,” maintaining a strong presence in the classroom and managing other instructional staff. <br>
- Deftly and patiently field student questions and provide feedback in lectures and office hours. <br>
- Build and refine data science curriculum and assignments. <br>
- Utilize student feedback and experimentation to continuously improve teaching and assessment methods. <br>
- Evaluate new tools, packages, and tutorials for use in the curriculum.
<br>
<br>
Professional Development: <br>
- At Galvanize, we strive to provide meaningful professional development opportunities to all of our employees. Here are just a few of the ways you will continue to grow and “level-up” as a data scientist and a teacher: <br>
- There’s no better way to learn than to teach! You’ll be amazed at how much you’ll develop skills you thought you were already an expert in just by helping students and planning lessons. <br>
- Opportunities to work with and learn from other data science and web development instructors in a highly collaborative and intellectually rich environment. <br>
- Previous projects have involved: Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Data Engineering and Architecture, Applied Statistics and Statistical Modeling. <br>
- Become the best instructor you can be with ongoing training and support.
<br>
<br>
Expected Experience: <br>
- Multiple years of experience in industry in a Data Scientist or Software Engineer role <br>
- Master's or PhD in a quantitative discipline such as engineering, statistics, or mathematics <br>
- Strong understanding in the topics we teach: scientific Python, probability, statistics (Probability, A/B Testing, Bayesian methods, Regression methods, Time Series), SQL, Machine Learning (Decision Trees, Random Forest, Boosting, Support Vector Machines, Clustering, Natural Language Processing, Recommenders, Graphs), Data Engineering (Hadoop, Hive, and MapReduce), Data Visualization (d3), and data at scale. <br>
- For more details on the program go to: http://www.galvanize.com/courses/data-science/#.Viqz4LQR8UU <br>
- Outstanding communication skillsMultiple years of experience teaching a quantitative subject strongly preferred
